thumb.title: 【重音テトSV Lite】３３７拍子って４拍子なんですかっ！？【波音リツ】
thumb.description: テト誕2025に間に合った！３３７拍子って４拍子だったんですねぇ...Youtube(色塗った版): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LIuTZ_T77vkマンガ(Pixiv): https://www.pixiv.net/artworks/130498266「テーマコミック」もあってる気がするのでVIVID_VOICE_FESTIVALにも参加っ！前の曲: sm44731642HotLimit PV再現: sm44731638使用ソフトUnreal EngineBlenderSynthesizer VUTAU(テトはLite版です)For non-Japanese viewers:The 3-3-7 beat (三三七拍子, San-San-Nana Byōshi) is a traditional Japanese rhythmic pattern. It's commonly used for clapping, cheering at sports games, and even in school events. As we’ve been doing this since grade school, it feels very familiar to us.Interestingly, in Japanese, we use the word Byōshi (拍子) for both this clapping rhythm and musical time signatures. But I never realized until now… in a musical sense, the 3-3-7 beat is actually just a 4-beat!
